title.rendered: India vs West Indies, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023: Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs, Pitch Report & Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable Playing XIs for India & West Indies

India: Shafali Verma, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Yastika Bhatia/Harleen Deol, Richa Ghosh (wk), Deepti Sharma, Pooja Vastrakar, Radha Yadav, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Renuka Thakur Singh

West Indies: Hayley Matthews (c), Stafanie Taylor, Shemaine Campbelle, Rashada Williams (wk), Shabika Gajnabi, Chinelle Henry, Chedean Nation, Afy Fletcher, Zaida James, Shamilia Connell, Shakera Selman

Venue: Newlands, Cape Town

Pitch Report for India vs West Indies, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 135

2nd innings average score: 142

Wickets per innings: 5

Type: Balanced

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 67%

Also Read:

Australia vs Bangladesh, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023 Fantasy Tips

How to choose a captain for your fantasy cricket team

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Smriti Mandhana averages 29, including the highest score of 74*, against West Indies. 

Jemimah Rodrigues averages a whopping 69 including the highest score of 50 against West Indies. At Cape Town, she has added 97 runs in 2 innings.

Harmanpreet Kaur loves playing against West Indies. In 19 T20Is, she has accumulated 470 runs at 47 and has the best bowling figures of 4 for 23.

Thanks to her all-round skills, Hayley Matthews has been a part of the Best11 for five consecutive T20Is. Against India, she averages 21 with the bat and has bagged 11 wickets including the best figures of 3 for 13.

Against India, Stafanie Taylor has collected 375 runs at 38 including the highest score of 90.

When these teams locked horns a few weeks ago, Deepti Sharma (3 for 11) and Rodrigues (42) were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 respectively.

All four half-centuries registered at Newlands in the last three games have been by the top-order batters.
